title: Nonius/tokio compat
body:
Changing the internal message channel to a futures 0.3 channel.

This moves #70 and #120 a bit forward.

title: Conversion from std::sync::Mutex to tokio 0.2. sync::Mutex
body:
This is a major refactoring that had at its aim to fix #112 (Get rid of std::sync::Mutex, since it can deadlock unFTP) and #109 (Stuck "waiting for welcome message" (Filezilla test)).

The pull request includes more than that since the move to `tokio::sync:Mutex` caused a lot of the code to be rewritten for tokio 0.2 which uses the new async/.await style futures. 

Breaking changes:
- Authenticators now use async functions with help from the [async-trait](https://crates.io/crates/async-trait) crate.
- `Server::certs` was renamed to `Server::with_ftps` and now takes a path to a DER-formatted PKCS 12 archive along with a password instead of the previous PEM formatted cert and key file paths.
- The REST Authenticator is broken in that it will do the same as the anonymous authenticator at the moment. To be fixed in an upcoming MR.

We also now uses [native-tls](https://crates.io/crates/native-tls) instead of [rustls](https://crates.io/crates/rustls) and [tokio-tls](https://crates.io/crates/tokio-tls) over our own custom TLS stream.

This MR addresses:
- #112 
- #109 
- #127
- #120 (partially)
- #70 (partially)

Also fixed the disabled TLS functionality again. Not finished but here is a MR so long

title: task(gcs): Handle error when metadata cannot be parsed

labels.name: unftp-sbe-gcs
labels.description: Everything to do with the Google bucket backend.

body:
This PR handles some parse errors in the GCS backend. If we encounter an error when we parse the metadata, we will return a TransientFileNotAvailable.

It also removes some duplication, and simplifies some type conversions. Specifically, `item_to_file_info` now uses `item_to_metadata`, and converting between SystemTime and chrono's DateTime now uses chrono's conversion trait.

This PR aims to DRY up the URI building for the GCS backend.

It also makes sure that all URIs are properly urlencoded.

title: do not block
body: To prevent ```.wait()``` calls during handling commands that reply on the control channel, the futures will be driven to completion the same way that is used for replying on the data channel.

title: do not block during size command
Use command pattern for commands
body:
This MR refactors the Server's `handle_command` method, by moving the logic for each command to a separate object that implements the new `Cmd` trait.

All logic was copy/pasted to their respective Command object. The commands can be refactored further, but I'd like to do that in a followup PR, in order to limit the amount of changes. One thing I'm thinking about is to bring more logic into the `impl ...` block, and have the `impl Cmd for ...` block simply have a delegating call to the underlying command object.

title: Implemented the (File modification time) MDTM command.
body:
See: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3659#section-3.1

> The FTP command, MODIFICATION TIME (MDTM), can be used to determine
   when a file in the server NVFS was last modified.

title: Obscure password in format directives
body: This PR wraps the password bytes into a password struct that implements the Display and Debug traits in such a way that it obscures the password when it's being logged.

title: Making server.process smaller
body:
The server.process method is currently 634 lines long and mixes many concerns making it unpleasant to work with. Also for event listening on the unFTP side we need something.

I suggest this refactor that introduces the **[chain-of-responsibility pattern](https://refactoring.guru/design-patterns/chain-of-responsibility)** and splits the method up in:

- process (62)
- handle_with_auth (21)
- handle_with_logging (6)
- handle_event (23)
- handle_command (461)
- handle_internal_msg (47)

`handle_command` is still too large but this refactor paves the way to later introduce a routing mechanism per command that allow us to split it up futher.

Because there is now a chain of responsibility it allows us to handle **cross cuttng concerns** like logging and authentication seperately in an **AOP** fashion. This will also make it easy to add a command in the chain from the unFTP side in order to do certain things. 

The `ensure_authenticated` and `respond` macros were no longer needed and I removed them. authentication checks is now handled via a whitelist in `handle_with_auth `

This merge can wait for other branches to merge first. The changes aren't as big as it seems, its merely moving code to other methods.

title: Switch to rustup minimal profile to avoid installing local docs
Fixes for FEAT and multiline responses.
body:
FEAT wasn't according to spec. Each feature line should start with a space. Also the features in FEAT are now sorted alphabetically.

Furthermore multiline responses in general wasn't completely accoding to spec. When a line in a multi-line response starts with a number it needs to be indented.

title: Implement STAT {path}
body:
This PR implements the path option for the `stat` command. This implementation diverges from the specification by always returning the file list if a path is given, rather than only in between file transfers.

```
         STATUS (STAT)

            This command shall cause a status response to be sent over
            the control connection in the form of a reply.  The command
            may be sent during a file transfer (along with the Telnet IP
            and Synch signals--see the Section on FTP Commands) in which
            case the server will respond with the status of the
            operation in progress, or it may be sent between file
            transfers.  In the latter case, the command may have an
            argument field.  If the argument is a pathname, the command
            is analogous to the "list" command except that data shall be
            transferred over the control connection.  If a partial
            pathname is given, the server may respond with a list of
            file names or attributes associated with that specification.
            If no argument is given, the server should return general
            status information about the server FTP process.  This
            should include current values of all transfer parameters and
            the status of connections.
```

title: publish the socket local IP in response to PASV
Implemented the REST command (#39).
body:
This implements the **_Restart of Interrupted Transfer (REST)_** command:

- Its parsing
- Basic Unit test
- Allowing Storage back-ends to say if they support this feature
- Advertising REST in the FEAT response if the storage back-end supports is
- Seeking to the REST offset during a RETR command.
- Seeking to the REST offset during a STOR command.

Only the filesystem back-end currently supports this feature

title: Allow support for mixed case commands
body:
According to RFC 959, article 5.3, commands should be case insensitive:

```
      The commands begin with a command code followed by an argument
      field.  The command codes are four or fewer alphabetic characters.
      Upper and lower case alphabetic characters are to be treated
      identically.  Thus, any of the following may represent the
      retrieve command:

                  RETR    Retr    retr    ReTr    rETr
```

This PR will normalize all incoming commands to uppercase, making it comply with this part of the spec.

title: Allow FTP clients to specify list options e.g. ls -la
body:
As libunftp Command::List only accepts path arguments and no options, this will break the clients for the MVP. When running the LIST command,
We should atleast ignore any list options (-la, -a) instead of interpreting these as path arguments.

In this PR we ignore the options
